thread.title: British actor live tweets about annoying passenger during flight
thread.title_full: British actor live tweets about annoying passenger during flight

title: British actor live tweets about annoying passenger during flight
text:
British actor live tweets about annoying passenger during flight Last updated 11:25, October 8 2015 @russelltovey/Twitter 
Live tweeting about an annoying passenger led to an unlikely friendship for British actor Russell Tovey. 
British actor Russell Tovey (Being Human) recently found himself in the unenvious position of sitting next to a "nightmare" passenger during a flight from London to New York. 
But instead of sitting there gritting his teeth during the flight, Tovey took to Twitter to vent his frustrations and found a couple of unlikely friends following his hilarious updates a few rows back. 
The annoyance begin when said passenger asked the cleary British Tovey if he was 'Australian'. Guy next to me thought I was Australian X — russell tovey (@russelltovey) October 3, 2015 
Other offences then ranged from stealing Tovey's blanket to snoring and sneezing - seven or eight times. He's also stolen my blanket and sneezed around about 7 or 8 times.. I said 'bless you' first three... I can't be bothered anymore X — russell tovey (@russelltovey) October 3, 2015 And it's kinda embarrassing.. I mean.. How much dust is there up your nose? X — russell tovey (@russelltovey) October 3, 2015 Oh it's coughing now X — russell tovey (@russelltovey) October 3, 2015 I'm actually freezing... Gonna ask for another blanket, he's not wearing any shoes.. X — russell tovey (@russelltovey) October 3, 2015 
Tovey was then given a surprise when he received an offer of a new blanket from a couple of blokes a few seats back. These guys are actually following my tweets from 3 rows behind me! Say hello to @0EmissionCar hahaha #mental X pic.twitter.com/TguXZUJazE — russell tovey (@russelltovey) October 3, 2015 Thanks for the blanket boys! @0EmissionCar :-) X
